snippet: Ms. Golden, who won five Clio Awards, rose from the steno pool to write copy for firms large and small. But she discovered her true calling by using humor to sell cheese in the 1980s.
abstract: Joy Golden, an advertising executive who rose through the ranks of major advertising agencies beginning in the 1950s, and who found her true calling in the 1980s when she created humorous radio spots for Laughing Cow, earning five Clio awards, dies at age 85.
lead_paragraph: Ms. Golden, who won five Clio Awards, rose from the steno pool to write copy for firms large and small. But she discovered her true calling by using humor to sell cheese in the 1980s.

headline.main: Joy Golden, Who Made Ads With Punch Lines, Dies at 85
headline.print_headline: Joy Golden Dies at 85; Made Ads With Punch Lines
